article.headline: Elon 88, Chattanooga 87
article.story: ELON, N.C. -- Lucas Troutman scored 21 points and Austin Hamilton added 20 for Elon, which edged Chattanooga 88-87 on Saturday night. Jack Isenbarger had 19 points and Ryley Beaumont 15 for the Phoenix (9-9, 4-3 Southern Conference), who were outplayed in many facets of the game but still held on to win. The Mocs outshot the Phoenix from 3-point range 47.4 percent (9 of 19) to 35.7 percent (10 of 28), from the foul line 78.3 percent (18 of 23) to 66.7 percent (16 of 24) and outrebounded them 42-36. Elon did force 15 Chattanooga turnovers, though, scoring 22 points off them. Isenbarger hit two free throws with 7 seconds left to put Elon up 88-85, and the Phoenix held on despite a late layup for Chattanooga. Omar Wattad had 25 points to lead the Mocs (9-12, 3-5).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
